column2: vênérunt gentes in hereditátem tuam~; polluvérunt templum sanctum tuum~; posuérunt Jerúsalim in pomórum custódiam. ^ O God
column3: the heathens are come into thy inheritance~; they have defiled thy holy temple~; they have set Jerusalem as a safekeep of fruits.

column1: 2 ^ Posuérunt morticína servórum tuórum escas vulatìlibus caĕli~; carnes sanctórum tuórum béstiîs terraĕ. ^ They have given the dead bodies of thy servants to be meat for the fowls of the air~; the flesh of thy saints for the beasts of the earth.
3 ^ Effudérunt sángŭinem eórum tamqŭam aqŭam in circùmitu Jerusalíme
column2: et non èrat qŭi sepelíret. ^ They have poured out their blood as water round about Jerusalem
column3: and there was none to bury them.

column1: 4 ^ Facti sumus oppróbrium vicínîs nostrîs~; subsannátio et illúsio hîs qŭi in circùmitu nostro sunt. ^ We are become a reproach to our neighbours~; a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.

column2: Dòmine~? ¿~Irásceris in finem~? ¿~Accendétur vèlut ignis zelus tuus~? ^ How long
column3: O Lord~? Wilt thou be angry for ever~? Shall thy zeal be kindled like a fire~?

column1: 6 ^ Effùnde iram tuam in gèntes qŭaĕ te non novérunt
column2: et in regna qŭaĕ nomen tuum non invocavérunt
column3: ^ Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that have not known thee
column4: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name

column2: et locum ejus desolavérunt. ^ because they have devoured Jacob~; and have laid waste his place.

column1: 8 ^ Ne memìnerîs iniquitátum nostrárum antiqŭárum~; cìto antìcipent nos misericórdiaĕ tuaĕ
column2: qŭia páŭperes facti sumus nìmis. ^ Remember not our former iniquities~; let thy mercies speedily prevent us
column3: for we are become exceeding poor.

column10: and for the glory of thy name
column13: and forgive us our sins for thy name's sake

column3: et innotéscat in natiónibus coram òculîs nostrîs ùltio sángŭinis servórum tuórum qŭi effúsus èst. ^ lest they should say among the Gentiles
column5: and let the revenging blood of thy servants
column7: be made known among the nations before our eyes.

column1: 11 ^ Intróeat in conspèctu tuo gèmitus compeditórum~; secùndum magnitúdinem bráchii tui pòsside fílios mortificatórum
column2: ^ Let the sighing of the prisoners come in before thee. According to the greatness of thy arm
column3: take possession of the children of them that have been put to death.

column1: 12 ^ et redde vicínîs nostrîs septùplum in sìnu eórum
column3: Dòmine. ^ And render to our neighbours sevenfold in their bosom
column4: the reproach of the same wherewith they have reproached thee

column3: confitébimur tìbi in sáĕculum~; in generatiónem et generatiónem adnuntiábimus laŭdem tuam. ^ But we thy people
column4: and the sheep of thy pasture
column5: will give thanks to thee for ever. We will show forth thy praise
